title: New Census Numbers Mean A Political Power Shift For Some States
description: The first set of results from the 2020 census are in, and according to the count, the official population of the United States is 331,449,281.
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: New Census Numbers Mean A Political Power Shift For Some States
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Some states have gained or lost Electoral College votes because of changes in population numbers recorded by the 2020 census.
itunes:subtitle: Some states have gained or lost Electoral College votes because of changes in population numbers recorded by the 2020 census.
content:encoded: The first set of results from the 2020 census are in, and according to the count, the official population of the United States is 331,449,281.
